item.description:
Come enjoy some early beach time! No crowds, no waiting.

Before we hit the beach we'll enjoy lunch at a local seafood venue (to be updated), then head out on the beach for walking, and shell/rock/sea glass collecting.

You can park at Salty Brine, it's right off the beach and restaurants are within walking distance.

Bring camera, chair and or blanket - hopefully we'll have some good weather.

Rain date Sunday, May 5th.

Â 

Day of Details

Lets meet at the Salty Brine Beach parking lot (parking should be available there and surrounding area) by 1:15. At that point we will break up into groups and head to one of the local restaurants for lunch (below is a list). If you have a question about a venue please visit their website or do your own search where a site address is not available. I will also have a list available with address/phone at lot.

If you arrive after 1:15 and we are no longer in the parking lot you can call me at 508-415-0590 or just head to one of the restaurants. Your prompt arrival though is greatly appreciated!

After lunch we'll head for the beach - see picture - at about 3:00 - 3:30. The beach isn't that long so we will all run into each other along the way.

Don't forget to bring a jacket and sunscreen and have a great time!

Restaurants within walking distance

  • George's of Galilee - http://www.georgesofgalilee.com
  • Champlin's Seafood - http://www.champlins.com
  • Buster Krab's Beach Bar & Burger Shack - http://www.busterkrabs.com
  • Port Side Restaurant


Restaurants short drive

  • Iggy's Doughboys - http://www.iggysdoughboys.com
  • Aunt Carries Seafood - http://www.auntcarriesri.com
  • Hammerhead Grillmore - http://www.hammerheadgrillri.com
  • Narragansett Grill - http://www.narragansettgrill.com
item.name: Beach Walk, shell, rock, sea glass collecting & Lunch
